meanings.definition: A vertical arrangement of objects on top of each other.
meanings.sent1: The stackups of books on the shelf reached the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: I organized the stackups of plates neatly in the cupboard.
meanings.sent3: The stackups of pillows on the bed looked like a fluffy tower.
meanings.sent4: The stackups of colorful blocks resembled a mini city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The stackups of boxes in the warehouse created a maze-like structure.

meanings.definition: The act of piling or arranging objects in a vertical manner.
meanings.sent1: Her stackups of laundry were waiting to be folded.
meanings.sent2: The stackups of dishes in the sink needed to be washed.
meanings.sent3: The stackups of shoes by the door made it hard to walk in.
meanings.sent4: The stackups of paperwork on his desk seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The stackups of presents under the tree made the room festive.
